sentences: Haavatud sõdalasel on soolikad välja jooksnud.
Lasen vargal soolikad välja 'tapan' varga ära.'
Kõik ta seelikud on soolikana torus.
context: The word 'tapan' in Estonian appears to be an interjection or exclamation used when catching a thief, as shown in the example sentence Lasen vargal soolikad välja 'tapan' varga ära.' which translates to 'I'll let the sweat out of the thief, I've caught the thief.' The word seems to function like a triumphant shout when apprehending someone. It's part of the expression 'soolikas' (lazy person/inactive) context but here serves as an interjection in this specific phrase.
